Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Scavenging \Scav"eng*ing\, p. pr. & vb. n. of {Scavenge}. Hence, n. (Internal-combustion Engines) Act or process of expelling the exhaust gases from the cylinder by some special means, as, in many four-cycle engines, by utilizing the momentum of the exhaust gases in a long exhaust pipe. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
scavenging adj 1: searching for and salvaging anything useful from discarded material; "scavenging larvae" 2: searching for and feeding on decaying matter; "scavenging hyenas and vultures"
